raw_comment: This graph depicts the proportion of how different energy sources are used. Coal and gas are used most, but are also fossil fuels. The learner enemies of Nuclear, hydroelectric, and wind/solar are used far less. I wonder how the unclean sources are still the majority when climate change and environmental health have been such prevalent topics of conversation for years. While it was expected that fossil fuels would still be used more, It is surprising that they still dominate as the main sources of energy. There has been a large upsurge in the interests of the environment, hence the amount of energy produced by clean materials should be rising as years pass. This relates to every community because the health of the planet is the most important thing in preserving the health of the people. We need to care for our environment because it is our only home. It is my hope that change continues to push the use of fossil fuels down. A possible title is “Clean v Fossil; Who’s in Charge?”
ace_sentences: The graph depicts the proportion of different energy sources that people use.
Coal is an energy source.
Gas is an energy source.
Coal and gas are used most.
Coal is a fossil fuel.
Gas is a fossil fuel.
Nuclear energy is used far less than coal and gas.
Hydroelectric energy is used far less than coal and gas.
Wind energy is used far less than coal and gas.
Solar energy is used far less than coal and gas.
Climate change is a prevalent topic of conversation.
Environmental health is a prevalent topic of conversation.
Unclean energy sources are still the majority of energy sources.
It was expected that fossil fuels would be used more than clean energy sources.
It is surprising that fossil fuels still dominate as the main energy sources.
Interest in the environment has increased.
If interest in the environment increases, then the amount of energy from clean sources should rise over the years.
This situation relates to every community.
The health of the planet is important for preserving the health of people.
We need to care for our environment.
The environment is our only home.
I hope that the use of fossil fuels decreases.
A possible title is "Clean v Fossil; Who's in Charge?"
